message:
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur and Airbus present “Arm of Achelous”, an event designed to challenge you to prove your dexterity through your mobile syringe actuated mechanical arm. Play out with your creativity to design a syringe-actuated arm which has the potential to move the given objects in a specified way. 
Prepare yourself to think out of box to devise ways to innervate your mechanical arm.
Submission Deadline: 20th December, 2017
Register at: http://www.ktj.in/event      
#KTJ2K18

Prepare yourself for the ultimate battle!
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur and Mouser Electronics present its awaited flagship event, Robowars.
The time has come to embrace this opportunity equip your machines with customized weapons to fight with your opponents and prove your mettle on the battlefield.

Submit your abstracts to submissions@ktj.in before 25th December 2017.
Register yourself at: www.ktj.in/event

#ktj2k18

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur and Airbus present Embetronix, a sophisticated electronics event which explores the core electronics aspects comprising communication, analog and digital circuit design. 
Set fire to your inquisitive spirits in digital wireless communication to prove your mettle in the field of Embedded Electronics. 
Submission Deadline: 20th December, 2017

To all the prodigies in embedded electronics - It’s time you embrace the opportunity to think beyond the usual and etch your name in the hall of fame.

We are happy to announce that Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS is hosting Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2017, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur. 
KWoC is a December long online program, open to students from all colleges. For those who already know about Google Summer of Code, KWoC is going to be very helpful for you. Register yourself at  http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in/ as a student and the instructions will follow you. 

For those who don't know about such open source programs, KWoC is a platform where you are going to learn about a new style of collaborative software development. Read more on the website.
In simple steps:
- Register yourself.
- Go through the projects.
- Choose one/two you want to work on.
- Contact the mentor of the project.
- Contribute!

We also invite enthusiastic mentors from all places to guide and share their knowledge and help students.
Mentors can register their projects on the official KWoC website http://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in/

story: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur added 27 new photos — with Ravindra Maurya and 16 others at G.D. Birla Sabhagar.
message:
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur conducted another edition of the Kolkata workshop on Robotics at G.D.Birla Sabhaghar, Ballygunge, Kolkata on 5th November, wherein, Robotics enthusiasts got an opportunity to probe deeper into the world of robotics in the most ingenious way. The workshop witnessed an overwhelming response by the students of Kolkata and nearby areas. 

Besides the workshop, Kshitij also launched new enthralling events there for its 15th edition, the details of which are available on our website www.ktj.in.

#Kolkata_Workshop
#KTJ_2K18

The children of today will make the India of tomorrow. This Children’s Day let’s relive our joyful childhood and pledge to serve our nation with our moral responsibilities to foster India's future.
Team Kshitij wishes you a very mirthful Children's day!

Time: 9:30 am onwards

Venue: G.D. Birla Sabhagar, Near Birla Mandir, Ballygunge, Kolkata 
Date: 5th November 2017 (Sunday)

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur invites all the students of Kolkata into the astounding world of robots. Come, be fascinated by them and get to know about the exciting new events of Kshitij 2018.

Venue: G.D. Birla Sabhaghar, Ballygunge, Kolkata

Date: 5th November 2017.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop-register

Hurry up as only limited seats available.

Blockchain is the world’s leading software for digital assets, but it’s possible applications are far wider. The technology emphasizes on encrypting the data and disintermediating several factors of various industries like education industry, preventing fraudulence and impersonation. The applications can be further extended up to risk management, maintaining immutable and transparent records, gaming and anything else one can think of.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with IBM India University Relations presents Blockchain Hackathon, which provides you an unparalleled opportunity to solve real world problems using the concepts of Blockchain.

Register at www.ktj.in/#ktj/Events -> IBM Blockchain Hackathon -> Blockchain Hackathon

Technology is not merely a science of techniques. It has become a way of life that is slowly permeating every nook and cranny of the world. With just 100 days left for the Asia's largest techno-management fest, it's time to gear up for the ultimate test of mettle. Make sure you register for the 3-day extravaganza as platforms do not get bigger than this and memories do not get more joyous than this.
#KTJ2k18

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur and American Express conducted the final round of Overnite on 4th October 2017, results are listed below-

1st -  P Hruday, M V S Desik, Aditya Kumar Sinha
2nd - Nisarg Shah, Siddharth Singh, Mayank Bhushan
3rd - Pranjal Shankhdhar, Anurag Anand, Shashank Srivastava

Congratulations to the winning teams!

Congratulations to the teams selected for the second round of Overnite!

In association with American Express, Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents the round 2 of Overnite, an ACM certified programming competition, with prizes worth INR 60,000. 
The event is open to all. The teams which are not shortlisted for the second round can still participate with a chance of winning exciting goodies.

Date: October 4, 2017.
Time: Starting at 6 PM.
Log on to http://hck.re/o37 for the event.

story: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.

message:
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur is back with the 2nd edition of its regional round Kascade, which will be conducted in the major cities across India. 

Prelims of the flagship events Nightshift, Math Olympiad, Source Code and Anadigix will be conducted. Teams that will be shortlisted in the prelims will be guaranteed a direct entry in the final round to be held at IIT Kharagpur during Kshitij in 2018. 

Stay tuned for more updates. 
#Kascade

Prelims of the flagship events Nightshift, Math Olympiad, Source Code and Anadigix will be conducted. Teams that will be shortlisted in the prelims will be guaranteed a direct entry in the final round to be held at IIT Kharagpur during Kshitij in 2018. 

Stay tuned for more updates.

In an unexpected but pleasant turn of events, one of India's finest stand-up comedians, Zakir Khan, had come to the IIT Kharagpur campus. His show had been one of the highlights of Kshitij 2017. 

Watch him grappling for words to express his feelings, as he relives his experience at Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur but in the end, he manages to do it in the way only he can.

#Zakir_on_KTJ
#Kshitij_faad_hai

A teacher takes a hand, opens a mind and touches a heart. 
Teachers aren't restricted to the people imparting education in the classrooms. There are a lot of things around us that have influenced our outlook, and helped us grow as a person. 
This Teacher's Day, Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur urges everyone to reflect on their parents, friends, acquaintances or even the thoughts and experiences, all of whom have shaped their formative years, and have played the role of a teacher in ways more than one.
Wish you all a very happy Teacher's Day.

Hello everyone, here's your chance to be a part of Asia’s largest techno-management fest. Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur is reaching out to diligent individuals from every college to be a campus representative and work alongside us to enhance your time management, teamwork and leadership skills while having a breathtaking experience. 
Register at https://tinyurl.com/ktj2018-cr. Win incentives, concessions and certification from IIT Kharagpur.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone, Eid Mubarak!

May the magic of this Eid bring lots of happiness in your life. May you celebrate it with your near and dear ones and may it fill your heart with wonders. 

This Eid, let's take a pledge to respect the differences in each of us and live in peace and harmony.

IBM, in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur, will be conducting a Tech Talk on Business Analytics and Business Computing at the S.N.Bose Auditorium (Main Building) on 1st September, from 6 PM onwards.

So, fuel your enthusiasm and join us to flourish the 15th edition of Kshitij. Register at http://tinyurl.com/KCASelections

story: Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.

Ahoy Freshers!

The time has come to witness the grandeur of yet another facet of the technosapien cosmos. So, hop on, sit back and construe as we delve deeper into this exhilarating spirit of Asia's largest techno-management fest.

Be there at Kalidas Auditorium on 27th August (Sunday) at 6 PM. Surprises await you!

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a very happy Ganesh Chaturthi. 
While the elders rejoice by embellishing the Ganesh idols in their homes, the younger ones are more inclined towards conspiring to get that extra ‘modak’ inconspicuously. 
Let's celebrate this auspicious day together and revere the elephant-headed deity, who is touted to be the remover of all obstacles.

Let's celebrate this auspicious day together and revere the elephant-headed deity, who is touted to be the remover of all obstacles.

The late night bhaat sessions over a cup of hot tea, the food joints and canteens that are a lifeline for the 'gourmand', the 2.2 rounds, the incessant cramming before the exams and the subsequent collective groan at the unfortunate results, all have been a source of countless indelible memories for all KGPians.

This 18th August, Kshitij pays a heartwarming tribute to the place that has and will shape our future. Happy Birthday, KGP!

#hbdkgp

This 18th August, Kshitij pays a heartwarming tribute to the place that has and will shape our future. Happy Birthday, KGP!

#hbdkgp

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a happy Independence Day. 
Along with flag hoisting and conducting cultural programmes, let's also remember and respect the sacrifices made by the freedom fighters. Although we have achieved autonomy, yet we are to free our country from poverty, religious tensions and racism. 

This Independence Day, let's join our hands together and pledge to maintain the sanctity of this country for perpetuity. Let's play our part in nation-building and make India a manufacturing hub, thereby promoting Make In India. 

Design Credits: Shubham Kumar

The 14th edition of Asia's largest techno-management fest witnessed a confluence of tech-enthusiasts, eminent personalities from across the globe, and the latest developments in science and technology, under a single umbrella.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents its Official Aftermovie for the 2017 edition, which pays a heartwarming tribute to the indelible memories gained during the 3-day extravaganza.

The bond between siblings is unbreakable. The petty fights over trivial things only serve to make their relation stronger. In spite of the enormous geographical distances, Rakshabandhan provides yet another spark in this beautiful relationship.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur pays a tribute to this bond, and wishes everyone a very Happy Rakshabandhan.

Design Credits : Khushaal Jaiswal

Kshitij, the annual techno-management fest of IIT Kharagpur heartily welcomes you to one of the premier institutions of the country, as you embark on the life changing journey to finding yourself. 
The first few days might be intimidating, but we assure you that this experience is going to imbibe within you indelible memories and intimate friendships to last a lifetime. 
Do meander into the odd lanes, enrich yourself with new experiences and explore new avenues, while you pursue your true self.
#KTJ_2K18

Design Credits: Darshak Mehta

The entire world stands shattered with the demise of one of the most gifted contemporary artists of all time.  
This serves as a reality check for everyone and goes to show that depression is indeed very real. 
Our social initiative Astitva launched last year aimed to address the stigma around mental health. 
Although a person may seem jovial from outside, but one doesn't really know if they're facing issues in their lives. The best thing one can do is to reach out and pay heed to their silent cries for help, that often go unheard.

Rest in peace, Chester Bennington. You will be dearly missed.

Design Credits: Sambhrant Kumar Singh
